memory.title: GitHub push blocked by Discord bot tokens in commit history
memory.content: GitHub secret scanning blocked pushes due to Discord bot tokens committed in old history (discord-listener.ts and server.ts). Two options: (1) visit the unblock URL GitHub provides to allow the push, or (2) scrub history with git filter-repo + force-push. The unblock URL is faster but the tokens remain in history. For production, scrub the history.
memory.rule: Never commit API tokens or bot tokens to source files. Use environment variables. If already committed, scrub with git filter-repo.

archived.reason: Superseded by mem_c9afde79

memory.title: Used hw_quick_insights to bypass full deliberation guardrails on a real decision
memory.content: Ran quick insights on "system explorer layout" which was clearly a design decision. All agents converged in 2 rounds with no tension. Then listed the missing guardrails as "unsolved problems" when they were already built. Root cause: context compaction lost working knowledge of deliberation system. Fix applied: hw_quick_insights now blocks decision-like topics with pattern matching and redirects to hw_plan_deliberation.
memory.rule: If agents will deliberate something that changes code, architecture, layout, or strategy, ALWAYS use hw_plan_deliberation with sub-questions. hw_quick_insights is ONLY for vague exploration with no action planned. The tool now enforces this in code.

archived.reason: Superseded by mem_3a15f5e9

memory.title: Method: 6-agent parallel research sprint
memory.content: Spawn 6 agents simultaneously, each researching a different angle of the same question. Agents cover: direct competitors, adjacent competitors, academic state of the art, practitioner experience, simple approaches that work, and failure modes/anti-patterns. Results come back in ~3-4 minutes. Synthesis happens in the main thread. Used multiple times: S53 memory systems research, earlier competitive intel runs. Use Sonnet 4.6 1M for research agents to save cost.
memory.rule: When researching a domain, always cover at least these 6 angles: competitors, academia, practitioners, simple baselines, and anti-patterns. Use Sonnet for research agents.

memory.title: Completed: Build deliberation mediator guardrails
memory.content: Three guardrails to prevent lazy consensus in deliberations: (1) Coverage gate -- track numbered sub-questions from the framing, verify each gets substantive treatment before synthesis. If a question was dismissed without engagement, force a steelman round. (2) Mediator intervention rule -- when an agent dismisses a topic without engaging its specific value prop, Claude pauses the round and redirects. (3) Randomize or rotate agent speaking order per round so no single agent always anchors the frame. Implementation: these are behavioral rules for Claude as mediator, but could also be encoded as a pre-synthesis checklist in the deliberation flow.

memory.title: Completed: Fix all fallout from state.json split -- full system audit and optimization
memory.content:
The state.json -> split files migration was incomplete. Fix everything:

1. ENOENT fix: Find and update all references to the old state.json path (session-start hook, MCP server, Rust commands)
2. Rust read cache: Add TTL-based file cache in lib.rs so multiple components reading the same file within 2-3s get cached results instead of hitting disk
3. Shared polling: Replace per-hook 10s intervals in useTauriData.ts with a single global 30s heartbeat that deduplicates
4. File watcher debounce: When MCP writes 3 files rapidly, batch the watcher events so components re-render once, not 3 times
5. Verify all hooks work with split files: session-start, pre-tool-gate, user-prompt-submit, post-edit-context
6. Test the full flow end-to-end

This is cleanup debt from the B+ state storage decision. Should have been caught during the original migration.

memory.title: Completed: Buddy animations don't work on non-HW projects
memory.content: Buddy's state machine is driven by hw-tool-summary events emitted by the MCP server loopback notify. When HW points at a project where MCP isn't running, those events never fire and buddy stays in 'waiting' state permanently -- no twitch, no bounce, no sound. Fix options: (1) Have buddy watch PTY output directly for activity signals (regex on terminal output), (2) Have the Tauri Rust backend emit hw-tool-summary based on file watcher activity instead of relying on MCP push, (3) Both -- MCP push for HW-aware projects, file watcher fallback for others.

memory.title: Completed: Fix clean shutdown: write endedAt to sessions.json on window close
memory.content: The sentinel always thinks window-close is a crash because no code writes endedAt to sessions.json before the process exits. memory.title: Completed: Auto-capture: add storage path so detected signals become memories automatically
memory.content: The signal detector pipeline detects and nudges but never auto-stores. Fix this gap. Options: 1. Server-side: add processSignalQueue() to MCP server that consumes high-confidence (0.7+) signals and auto-stores them via storeMemory(). Run during hw_store_memory or hw_retrieve_memories calls. 2. Keep nudge system for low-confidence signals but make the "STOP and evaluate" behavior automatic. Decision needed on which approach. The current system wastes detected signals -- detection without storage is waste.

archived.reason: Bulk archive: task-receipt win with zero access

memory.title: Completed: Boardroom anti-groupthink: independent initialization + selective history
memory.content: Restructure runBoardroom into phases based on research findings: Phase 1 (rounds 1): Independent thinking -- each agent sees only topic + whiteboard, no chat history. Forms position independently. Phase 2 (rounds 2-3): Selective sharing -- agents see whiteboard + own prior messages + compressed summary of others' positions. NOT full transcript. Phase 3 (rounds 4+): Convergence -- synthesis round, flag disagreements as valuable. This prevents anchoring bias (r=0.902 sycophancy correlation), groupthink (80%+ collapse), and produces more diverse outputs (research: embedding similarity 0.791 -> 0.511 without shared context).

memory.title: Completed: App loading screen or faster startup
memory.content: The app shows a blank white screen while loading, making it impossible to tell if it's broken or just slow. Investigate what's causing the slow load -- could be heavy JS bundle, synchronous state reads, or Rust init. A Tauri splash screen (native window) or an inline HTML loading indicator in index.html (before React mounts) are both viable approaches.
